title: Prove search tool invocation from chat - find explicit trigger message
description:
GOAL: Prove the search tool CAN be called from a chat message and returns REAL events (not demo/mock).

TASKS:
1. Find the exact message that forces the clarifying agent to set ready_to_search=True
2. Send that message to backend via curl/script and verify search_events() is called
3. Verify REAL Eventbrite results are returned (source='eventbrite', not 'demo')
4. Document the exact trigger message that works

The agent prompt says 'SEARCH EARLY AND OFTEN' but it's not happening. Find why.

DELIVERABLE: A curl command or script that:
- Sends a message to POST /api/chat/stream  
- Triggers search_events tool invocation
- Returns real events (not demo data)

NOTE: Eventbrite API may be returning 404 (deprecated). If so, document this as a blocker and suggest alternatives.

DO NOT MARK COMPLETE until you have a working command that triggers the search tool.
close_reason: Fixed: chat history now sent to backend, search tool invocation verified

title: LLM Loop Productionization - Eliminate Hallucinations
description:
Harden the Calendar Club AI chat from demo to production quality.

## Scope
- Eliminate silent mock data fallbacks
- Enforce grounded agent behavior  
- Validate all tool outputs
- Wire up session state
- Add structured logging
- Add test coverage

## Phases
1. Eliminate Silent Mock Data Fallback (search_events)
2. Fix refine_results Phantom Behavior
3. Wire Up Session State
4. Harden ClarifyingAgent Prompt
5. Add Test Coverage
6. Environment and Configuration Cleanup

## Success Criteria
- python -m pytest api/ -v (all pass)
- python -m mypy api/ (pass)
- ruff check api/ (pass)
- DEMO_MODE=false with no EVENTBRITE_API_KEY returns 'not available', NOT mock events
- DEMO_MODE=true clearly labels demo/sample events

## Critical Files
- api/agents/search.py - search_events, refine_results tools
- api/agents/clarifying.py - ClarifyingAgent prompt
- api/index.py - SSE streaming, session handling
- api/config.py - new config module

Use OPENAI_API_KEY and EVENTBRITE_API_KEY env vars for integration testing.
close_reason: Completed all 6 phases: demo mode gate, source attribution, session logging, grounding rules, test coverage (45 tests), centralized config

- put_many() - store events

- search(sources, start_date, end_date, location) - filter and return matching events

This breaks the cache-first pattern in search_events().

title: WeekView container component
description:
Create the main WeekView component at frontend/components/calendar/WeekView.tsx

## Visual Requirements (from mockup)
- 7-day grid layout (SUN-SAT)
- Weekend columns with bg-cream shading
- Today column with ring prominence
- Vertical month indicator on left ('AUGUST 2025')
- Left margin bullet indicators
- Notebook grid background

## Props Interface
```typescript
interface WeekViewProps {
  events: CalendarEvent[];
  weekStart: Date; // Sunday
  onEventClick: (event: CalendarEvent) => void;
  onEventHover?: (event: CalendarEvent | null) => void;
  focusedDay?: Date;
}
```

## Instrumentation
- results_viewed event on render

Reference: Spec Part 2, mockup screenshot
close_reason: Work merged to main by refinery

title: BUG: Eventbrite API 404 - events/search endpoint not found
description:
## Error
```
HTTP Request: GET https://www.eventbriteapi.com/v3/events/search/... 404 NOT FOUND
```

## Problem
The Eventbrite /v3/events/search/ endpoint returns 404. This endpoint may be:
1. Deprecated by Eventbrite
2. Wrong URL format
3. Requires different authentication

## Investigation
1. Check Eventbrite API docs for current event search endpoint
2. May need to use /v3/destination/search/ or /v3/organizations/{id}/events/
3. Check if API key scope is correct

## File
api/services/eventbrite.py - the API client
close_reason: Fixed: The official /v3/events/search/ endpoint was deprecated in 2020. Updated to use Eventbrite's internal destination API (/api/v3/destination/) which powers their website. Added fallback handling and proper error messages.

title: Fix: LLM not setting ready_to_search and search_profile
description:
The clarifying agent says 'I'm searching...' but doesn't set the structured output fields.

## Problem
Line 148 of index.py requires BOTH:
```python
if output.ready_to_search and output.search_profile:
```
If either is missing, search never triggers.

## Investigation Steps
1. Add debug logging to print output.ready_to_search and output.search_profile values
2. Test with various prompts to see what the LLM returns
3. Review the prompt in clarifying.py - may need better instructions for structured output
4. Check if SearchProfile schema is too complex for LLM to populate correctly

## Potential Fixes
- Add explicit examples of setting ready_to_search=True with search_profile in prompt
- Simplify SearchProfile (datetime fields may be hard for LLM)
- Add Field descriptions with format hints
- Consider using function calling instead of structured output
close_reason: Merged to main

title: BUG: Event loop is closed error in Eventbrite search
description:
## Error
```
ERROR:api.agents.search:Eventbrite API error: Event loop is closed
```

## Root Cause
The `search_events()` function in api/agents/search.py is trying to run async code (httpx) from a sync context using:
```python
with concurrent.futures.ThreadPoolExecutor() as executor:
    future = executor.submit(asyncio.run, _fetch_eventbrite_events(profile))
    events = future.result(timeout=30)
```

This creates a NEW event loop in a thread, but it conflicts with the already-running FastAPI event loop. When the thread's loop closes, httpx connections get corrupted.

## Fix Options
1. Make `search_events()` async and await it directly
2. Use `asyncio.run_coroutine_threadsafe()` with the existing loop
3. Use a sync HTTP client (requests) instead of async httpx

## Files
- api/agents/search.py:145-165 - the problematic code
- api/services/eventbrite.py - the async httpx client
close_reason: Merged to main

title: Vercel Deployment: Consolidate API and Backend
description:
# Vercel Deployment Epic

Deploy Calendar Club to Vercel with Next.js frontend and Python FastAPI backend.

## Key Pattern
- FastAPI runs as Vercel serverless functions in /api/
- Next.js rewrites /api/* requests to the Python backend
- In dev: FastAPI on port 8000, Next.js proxies
- In prod: Both deployed to Vercel

## Tasks
1. Update api/index.py to import backend routes
2. Update next.config.ts for development proxy
3. Update vercel.json for production routing
4. Replace SQLite sessions with persistent storage
5. Test on Vercel preview

## References
- https://vercel.com/docs/frameworks/backend/fastapi
- https://vercel.com/templates/next.js/nextjs-fastapi-starter
close_reason: Vercel config fixed: routing for Next.js + FastAPI, requirements synced. History passed via API so no persistent storage needed.

title: CRITICAL: Remove ALL demo mode and mock data code paths
description:
NEVER show mock/demo data to users. This violates CLAUDE.md rules.

## Remove ALL of these:
1. DEMO_MODE config flag - delete it entirely
2. _get_mock_events() function in api/agents/search.py
3. All 'source: demo' code paths
4. Any hardcoded event data
5. Demo/sample events in refine_results()

## Replace with:
- If no API key: return 'Event search not available' message
- If no results: return 'No events found' message
- NEVER return fake events

## Files to check:
- api/agents/search.py - has _get_mock_events()
- api/config.py - has demo_mode flag
- api/index.py - may reference demo mode

This is a CRITICAL bug. Mock data erodes user trust.
close_reason: Merged to main

title: Refactor: Disable Eventbrite search, migrate Exa to official SDK
description:
DEPENDS ON: Registry pattern implementation (club-enm)

After the EventSource registry is in place and Exa is registered:

1. Comment out Eventbrite search integration in search.py (keep service for future enrichment)
2. Migrate from raw httpx to exa-py SDK
3. Fix websets endpoint (was /websets, should be /websets/v0/websets/ with nested search object)
4. Use SDK's wait_until_idle() instead of manual polling
5. IMPORTANT: Follow the EventSource registry pattern established in club-a0c

The exa_client.py migration should:
- Implement the EventSource interface from api/services/base.py
- Register with the global registry
- Use the SDK methods that map to our EventSource contract

Research doc: throughts/shared/research/2026-01-11-event-search-api-flow.md

Key files:
- api/services/exa_client.py - Replace with SDK calls, follow registry pattern
- api/services/eventbrite.py - Add comment about enrichment-only use
- api/agents/search.py:335-349 - Comment out eventbrite integration
- api/services/background_tasks.py - Update webset creation
- requirements.txt - Add exa-py

title: DiscoveryChat container
description:
Create DiscoveryChat at frontend/components/discovery/DiscoveryChat.tsx

## Chat Flow States
1. Initial Prompt - hero + input + quick picks + recent searches
2. Clarifying Questions - agent asks 2-4 questions via chips
3. Processing - skeleton loading, 'Searching through X events...'
4. Results Preview - 3-5 event cards inline, 'View full week' CTA
5. Week View Transition - navigate to WeekView with filters

## Visual Design
- Chat card: white bg, border-light, shadow-md, 12px radius
- Agent bubbles: brand-green left border
- User bubbles: accent-orange left border
- Notebook grid background visible

## Props
```typescript
interface DiscoveryChatProps {
  onSearch: (query: SearchQuery) => void;
  onResultsReady: (events: CalendarEvent[]) => void;
  initialQuery?: string;
}
```

Reference: Spec Part 3
close_reason: Work merged to main by refinery

title: Fix chat history state management - history not sent to backend
description:
CRITICAL BUG: Chat history is not being sent from frontend to backend. The api.chatStream() call passes history: [] (empty array). This causes the agent to have no context of previous messages - it cannot remember what was discussed.

PROOF REQUIRED:
1. Send multiple messages in sequence
2. Verify backend receives full history (not empty array)
3. Verify agent responses show awareness of previous messages
4. Test: 'I want AI events' then 'Actually make it free only' - agent should remember first message

Current state: Frontend has messages[] but doesn't pass to backend.
Backend has SessionManager (SQLite) but isn't using it.

Fix options to evaluate:
A) Frontend sends history[] with messages (stateless backend)
B) Backend uses SQLite session manager (stateful backend)  
C) Hybrid - frontend sends recent history, backend persists full

DO NOT MARK COMPLETE until you have proven multi-turn context works.
close_reason: Fixed: chat history now sent to backend, search tool invocation verified

title: LLM-Orchestrated Quick Picks - Dynamic Conversation Flow
description:
Transform discovery chat from frontend-orchestrated hardcoded flow to fully LLM-orchestrated conversation.

## Key Changes
1. Initial quick picks are static conversation starters (label vs. expanded value)
2. Subsequent quick picks are LLM-generated per turn
3. LLM decides when to search (ready_to_search flag)
4. No static fallback - if LLM fails to generate picks, just don't show any

## Phases
1. Backend: AgentTurnResponse schema, update ClarifyingAgent, streaming events
2. Frontend: Handle quick_picks events, update DiscoveryChat
3. Cleanup: Deprecate ClarifyingQ, add tests

## Files to Modify
- api/models/conversation.py (new)
- api/agents/clarifying.py (update output_type, instructions)
- api/index.py (handle quick_picks, ready_to_search, fix event types)
- frontend/src/lib/api.ts (QuickPickOption type)
- frontend/src/components/discovery/DiscoveryChat.tsx (major refactor)
- frontend/src/components/discovery/QuickPicks.tsx (label vs value)

## Success Criteria
- make check passes
- First turn shows static quick picks
- LLM responses include dynamic quick picks
- ready_to_search=True triggers search
- Full conversation flow works e2e
close_reason: Completed: Extended ChatStreamEvent types, refactored DiscoveryChat for LLM-driven quick picks, deprecated ClarifyingQ

title: Telemetry setup (HyperDX)
description:
Set up instrumentation at frontend/lib/telemetry.ts

## Required Events
- search_performed: query, parsedIntent, chips_used
- clarification_answered: question_type, answer, method
- results_viewed: count, latencyMs, from
- event_clicked_out: eventId, source, category
- calendar:event_hover: eventId, dayOfWeek

## Implementation
- HyperDX + OpenTelemetry integration
- Session UUID in localStorage (persists across visits)
- Event batching for performance
- Error boundary tracking

## Environment
- HYPERDX_API_KEY in .env.local

Reference: TECHSTACK.md:259-264, Spec instrumentation sections
close_reason: Completed in Phase 0 UX convoy, merged to main

title: ClarifyingQ component
description:
Create ClarifyingQ at frontend/components/discovery/ClarifyingQ.tsx

## Clarifying Questions Rubric
Agent asks up to 4 questions based on missing info:

| Missing | Question | Chips |
|---------|----------|-------|
| Time | 'When are you looking?' | [Today] [This weekend] [Next week] [Pick dates] |
| Category | 'What kind of events?' | [AI/Tech] [Startups] [Community] [All of the above] |
| Location | 'How far will you go?' | [Downtown only] [Within 15 min] [Anywhere in Columbus] |
| Cost | 'Free, paid, or both?' | [Free only] [Any price] |

## Behavior
- Questions appear as agent-style chat bubbles
- User can respond via chips OR free-form text
- After 2-3 answers, proceed with search
- clarification_answered instrumentation event

Reference: Spec Part 3 Clarifying Questions Rubric
close_reason: Work merged to main by refinery
